text: It's like night and day, really. In the Coast Guard, everything was fast-paced and urgent. We were constantly on the move, always responding to one crisis or another. But here by the lake, life is slow and deliberate. I have time to breathe, to think, and to appreciate the little things. It's a stark contrast, but one that I've come to cherish deeply. It's as if I've finally found a balance that was missing before.
label: joy

text: That's a big question. I think, looking back, the most important lesson I've learned is resilience. Life throws you into storms, both literal and metaphorical. It's about finding the strength to face them, but also knowing when to step back and seek peace. My time in the Coast Guard was filled with challenges that taught me the value of perseverance and teamwork. But living by the lake has shown me the beauty of stillness and reflection. It's important to find a balance between the two—to work hard when needed, but also to make time to heal and appreciate the world around you. It’s all part of the journey, and I'm grateful for every step.
label: joy

text: Well, the community changed, that's for sure. It never quite came back to what it was in those early days at the shop.
